name: Apartment Santa Monaca
description:
Location details.
The bridge right next to the apartment is Ponte della Carraia, where it is possible to find excellent cafes' and restaurants and just walk through streets with unbeatable character and fantastic shopping. All of the city's main monuments and points of interests can be quickly and easily reached in a just a few minutes walk. To name a few examples: world renowned Ponte Vecchio (Old Bridge) is just a about a 5 minutes walk away, the Uffizi museum and Piazza dell Signoria .
host_about:
Ciao a tutti, il mio nome è Matilde, amo Firenze la  mia città .
Posso aiutarvi a  scoprire una città totalmente sconosciuta ai turisti di cui sicuramente vi innamorerete
Le persone di me dicono che sono una persona molto solare ed una persona molto paziente.
Sono graditi ospiti di diverse lingue perchè sono parlare anche Inglese e spagnolo.
Vi aspetto.

name: Boboli Garden S. Spirito Center
description:
The apartment is located in the heart of Florence, between Piazza Santo Spirito and Piazza Pitti .
An eclectic mix of modern and old, this classic, sleek and funky apartment is situated in a quiet yet central position. A very well restored flat is located in the historical heart of Florence on ‘Santo Spirito”. This apartment offers a golden opportunity to fully experience the wonderful Florentine lifestyle.
At only 2 minutes walk from Boboli garden and Pitti

name: Marignolle relais & charme Florence
description:
Situated just three kilometres far from the historical centre of Florence, this little gem of a hotel overlooks the beautiful hillside countryside around the town.
The ten spacious rooms are immaculately styled reflecting the owners' impeccable taste
neighborhood_overview:
Our Relais takes the name of the hill where it is placed in Florence.
The Marignolle hill is located only 3,5 kilometers from Porta Romana, south acces of the historic center of Florence reachable in just 8 minutes by car/taxi.
Marignolle today is one of the most prestigious residential areas of Florence, rich of Renaissance villas surrounded by cypress and olive trees.
Three minutes from here you will find the Medici Villa of Marignolle and the square with the medieval church.
host_about: Sono nato e vissuto a Firenze...è la mia città. Sono laureato in Scienze politiche economiche all'Università Cesare Alfieri. Nell'anno 2001 ho deciso di condividere con ospiti provenienti da tutto il mondo la proprietà di famiglia creando un Relais di Charme. Da quel momento mi dedico tutti giorni a questo lavoro che è diventato una grande passione.

name: Apartment PonteVecchio - Nel cuore del Centro
description:
Fabulous apartment located on the first floor (= seventeen steps and elevator that will take you next to the front door of the house) in a 1600-1700 building.
This apartment was completely restored in 2014, preserving the original 1600-1700 frescoes that are on all the interior walls
Its beautiful balcony and windows overlook the Famous Loggia del Porcellino.
Thoughtfully furnished and stylish high-end furniture makes it a real gem.

The apartment was completely restored ( excluding the frescoes) in JUNE 2014 with the highest quality materials and all the comforts you need and tastefully furnished. The building is from 1200 and inside the entire apartment, the interior walls have original frescoes and not restored, from the year 700. Ideal for those who want to experience the history of Florence. It is in a great location and especially in the middle of the pedestrian area. For those who love to visit the most important monuments and museums of the city, you
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is in the most important district of the historic center.
It has the largest balcony in the entire square.
Located a few minutes walk from museums, monuments and the most important

An example = When leaving the building door:
- on the left after 30 meters you will find yourself in Piazza Signoria with the Uffizi Museum and Palazzo Vecchio, if you continue for 70 meters you will find yourself crossing Ponte Vecchio.
- on the right you will find yourself 3 minutes from the Cathedral of the Duomo.
host_about: Salve! Mi chiamo Lorenzo. Sono nato e vivo a Firenze. Provengo da un antica famiglia fiorentina. Ho una famiglia stupenda composta da mia moglie ed un bambino meraviglioso di nome Matteo. Sul lavoro sono piuttosto perfezionista e mi piace fare sentire i clienti come se fossero a casa loro dando anche la mia totale disponibilità durante il loro soggiorno.

name: Beautiful Studio Loft Apartment
description: Recently renovated two-story studio loft apartment in the very heart of Florence, just steps from the Duomo. Located on the same street as the famous Galleria dell'Accademia - where you will find Michelangelo's masterpiece, David! The apartemnt is well furnished with, washer, dishwasher, microwave, toster, coffe machine and a new Smart TV you can use with your Netflix account.
neighborhood_overview:
You can't get more central than this flat. Located just steps from the Piazza del Duomo, it is in the very heart of Florence. On the same street, you will find just 2 blocks away, the Accademia Gallery which houses the famous David statue by Michelangelo. The central market is less than 5 minutes away and the area is rich with great restaurants and shopping. From this spot, you can be almost anywhere in central Florence in less than 15 minutes on foot.

You will also benefit from the expertise of someone who has lived in the area for many years so you will have no shortage of recommendations on places to eat, drink, shop or visit. All you have to do is ask!
host_about: Ciao e grazie anticipatamente per la tua curiosità nel nostro appartamento. Sono nato a Firenze e vissuto per 14 anni in Inghilterra dove ho studiato e lavorato. Sono innamorato della mia città ma adoro viaggiare e esplorare nuovi posti, conoscere e fare amicizia con nuove persone. Mi auguro che la tua visita a Firenze rimarrà nei tuoi ricordi. Ovunque tu vada qualsiasi cosa tu decida di fare ti auguro buona esplorazione!

name: Matrimoniale con balcone
description: Zona Campo di Marte quiet street, 20'WALK TO GET TO DOWNTOWN.  The centre can also be reached by bus no. 17-20-10-11 or train.  Nearby is the Municipal Stadium and the Mandela forum for concert enthusiasts. Three convenience stores, Carrefour, Conad and Pam, 2 Laundromats and several shops.  By downloading CITY BIKE APP you can rent a bike at any time.  It is a very convenient and not expensive service.
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood, if you exclude the days of the game and the big concerts, is very quiet. It is very green and if one wants to go jogging in the morning there are no problems just go around the whole field of Mars. The centre is about a 20-minute walk away. Or about 100 meters away is the bus stop n 17-10-11 -20 that stops in Piazza San Marco where there is the Accademia museum. The 11th and 10th also stop at the station. In Via Marconi, on the other hand, there is the stop of no. 11, which on the one hand leads to the Santo Spirito and San Frediano areas, Piazza Pitti. On the other side you can go to Fiesole. At the station of the Mars field you can take the n.12-13 that lead to the square Michelangelo.

name: Lovely downtown house with private garden
description:
A unique and antique detached countryhouse just a few minutes from the monuments of the Old Town and very close to the Piazzale Michelangelo belvedere.
A perfect accomodation where to rest after the visit of the city and where to enjoy your time in a quiet green area.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located a few hundred meters from the Arno river, at the foot of the hill overlooking Florence and where you can enjoy the breathtaking view of the Piazzale Michelangelo. In a few minutes walk along a majestic boulevard you can reach the Romanesque Basilica of San Miniato al Monte, a must for any visit of Florence.
A short distance away, reachable along the Arno or through a romantic inner lane, is also the most picturesque district of San Niccolò from which you can scramble up the hill to the lookout Medici fortress of Forte Belvedere.

The historic center is easily accessible by several bus lines (5-10 minutes) or with a fascinating walk (15-20 minutes) on the Lungarno, the road that runs along the river: in a short time you can reach the Basilica of Santa Croce, Ponte Vecchio, Piazza della Signoria and the Dome.

The house, despite being so close to the city center, is totally immersed in the tranquility of nature: trees, woods, squirrels and he
host_about:
I’m living in Firenze with my wife Cristina and my teenage son Alessandro. 
My greatest passions are cinema, books, art, music and, of course, travelling. 
Cristina is a psychotherapist while I work as a tv/radio host and as a writer.

neighborhood_overview: It's a very lively, characteristic and charming neighborhood thanks to the presence of the market and many small venues frequented at every hour by locals, as well as by tourists. Here you can try and taste all kinds of Tuscan and Italian food.
host_about: Sono una persona molto cordiale e ho molti interessi: arte, architettura e creatività in genere. Mi piace viaggiare ed incontrare nuove persone e nuovi amici.

name: I Medici Apartment is a house exclusively for you
description:
Fabulous apartment, located on the first floor (= upper = eighteen steps = a single ramp of straight stairs), of a building from 1500-1600.
The silence and tranquility you will find inside it will affect you.
This apartment was carefully restored in 2016, safeguarding the original frescoes from 1600-1700 (present in all the walls) and pulling them together with elegant high-end furnishings that make it truly a jewel
The house has windows with soundproofing system that overlook the houses of the San Lorenzo district.

The apartment was completely renovated (two years of work) we finally managed to finish the work. So long because we had to protect the original frescoes of the century '700 beginning of the century' 800 that are located all over the walls of the entire structure. The facility is equipped with the new: Water and Light system (certified facilities); Heating Excellent; Windows with soundproofing, air-conditioning of the "Daikin" = with the opportuni
neighborhood_overview:
Apartment in the district of San Lorenzo, a few minutes walk from the most important:
Museums and Artworks located in the historic center and beyond

It is also 300 meters from all the main means of transport:

- Taxi

- Train (Central Station of Santa Maria Novella = arrival or departure for the desired destinations outside the city)

- Coaches and Shuttles(for shopping in the best outlets in Tuscany or to visit Chianti)

host_about: Salve! Mi chiamo Lorenzo. Sono nato e vivo a Firenze. Provengo da un antica famiglia fiorentina. Ho una famiglia stupenda composta da mia moglie ed un bambino meraviglioso di nome Matteo. Sul lavoro sono piuttosto perfezionista e mi piace fare sentire i clienti come se fossero a casa loro dando anche la mia totale disponibilità durante il loro soggiorno.

name: Cozy Room with Private Bathroom and Breakfast
description:
Bianca B&B is located in a quiet residential area provided with shops and public transport. The town centre is reachable in 10 minutes by tram or with a 20 minute walk. The main train station of Santa Maria Novella, the exhibition complex and the hospital area of Careggi and Meyer are within a short distance.
We offer all that is needed for the comfort of your stay in Florence: large silent rooms, big comfortable beds, tasty genuine breakfasts.
host_about:
Hi, my name is Lorenzo.
I was born in the late ‘70s and I have always lived in Florence, being aware that my home town is a global city which has built its identity on the relations with its visitors for centuries.
In this town the passion for art and theatre has inspired my studies, here my work experiences have always allowed me to be in close contact with others, here I have been able to cultivate a taste for the Tuscan cuisine and wines.
From here I have traveled round Europe and to other continents developing the idea that tourism is an enjoyable way to discover the world.
Here I have the pleasure of welcoming my guests and I have decided to do so according to an idea of responsible sustainable tourism.
Bianca B&B uses energy from renewable sources, low environmental impact technologies and local products for breakfast in oder not only to preserve the environmental, cultural and social heritage of our town, but also to improve the quality and comfort of your holidays.

name: Casa Biba - apartment in the heart of Florence
description: This apartment of about 90sqm, obtained by a former 16th-century convent, has a wooden paneled ceiling and is located in the historical center in Santo Spirito. Casa Biba is one of the few houses inside the city walls that has not only one, but two small balconies overlooking the red rooftops of Florence!
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in Santo Spirito, a neighborhood well-known for being home to plenty of artisan workshops and typical restaurants.
Piazza Santo Spirito, which can be reached on foot in less than 5 minutes, is the perfect place to dive into the Florentine "movida".
In close proximity to the apartment, you will find a Conad grocery store (open 7 days a week), many bars, typical wineries (the oldest one is located right in front of Casa Biba) and some of the most famous ice-cream parlors of Florence.
The closest sights (Ponte Vecchio, Palazzo Pitti, the Boboli Gardens, Piazza del Carmine, Porta Romana, La Specola and Teatro Goldoni) are all 5-10 minutes away on foot.
In Via Maggio you will find the oldest artisan workshops, and we recommend that you head over to Via Tornabuoni to look at the beautiful high fashion stores.

name: Apartment a few steps from Uffizzi and Signoria
description:
The apartment is located in via de Neri, the street that connects Piazza Santa Croce with Piazza della Signoria, where Palazzo Vecchio can be found and very near the Uffizi gallery..You'll be in the heart of Florence!
It is only 5 minutes walk to Ponte Vecchio, 7 minutes to the Duomo and 1,5km to the railway station "Firenze Santa Maria Novella". Ten metres from the main door there is the best street-food stall in the city, "All'antico vinaio" where you can eat the best sandwiches in Florence.
neighborhood_overview:
Santa Croce is one of the most typical neighborhood of Florence. You're in the heart of the city and as I've already say you're near to everything.
Two minutes from the main door there is also a supermarket where you can buy all that you need.
Very close to home there is a pay parking for the cars, the “Florence Parking - Tintori”.
You can book the place for your car on the web site.
host_about:
Sono un giovane Dottore in Giurisprudenza laureatosi presso l'Università di Firenze, sono nato nel 1996, e negli anni universitari ho trovato in Airbnb una piattaforma ideale per svolgere un’attività da una parte economicamente utile per me, e dall’altra funzionale a chiunque lo voglia di visitare Firenze nel modo più fiorentino possibile. 
Nel rapporto con il cliente cerco di essere sempre il più confidenziale e, al tempo stesso, professionale possibile.

I am a young Doctor of Law graduated from the University of Florence, I was born in 1996, and during my university years I found in Airbnb an ideal platform to carry out an activity on the one hand economically useful for me, and on the other functional for anyone who wants to visit Florence in the "most Florentine way" possible. 
In the relationship with the guests I always try to be as confidential and, at the same time, professional as possible.

name: The cozy painted house in Florence
description:
Bright apartment located in the picturesque Piazza della Calza, at the first floor of a XV century building decorated with a unique frescoed facade. It's the perfect starting point to visit Florence, finding yourself inside the antique walls and close to Piazzale Michelangelo. You can reach Ponte Vecchio in 12' on foot. This is the square where the scene of Dan Brown's "Inferno" was filmed

Look "the cozy painted 2.0": https://www.airbnb.it/rooms/19717860
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the San Frediano/Santo Spirito area, "the coolest neighbourhoods of the world" according the Lonely Planet. You can discover the real Florentine life. You will be surrounded by little artisan shops and a lot of restaurants and trattorias. There is also a supermarket far only 50m from the house.
host_about: Ho 40 anni, sono nata e cresciuta a Firenze e non potrei immaginare di vivere in un altro posto. Amo la mia città ma mi piace molto anche viaggiare, specialmente i viaggi itineranti. Sono una persona solare, mi piace stare in compagnia, organizzare cene e feste. Cucinare è una mia passione (e anche mangiare), adoro gli animali e le passeggiate in montagna. Portatemi in un rifugio col sole e con un piatto di canederli e mi avrete fatto contenta!

name: B - Appartamenti CORSO 3 - Nel cuore di Firenze
description:
The delightful mini apartment, finished renovating completely in May 2020, is located in Via del Corso 3 on the first floor of a building from the '200: ideal for two guests who want to visit Florence on foot.
It consists of a large room with a double bed and a full kitchenette with table and chairs.
There is air conditioning, TV, wifi, all the necessary linens and a hairdryer available for guests to guests.
The bathroom is equipped with a bidet and shower.
Enjoy living downtown!
neighborhood_overview:
A STONE'S THROW FROM THE DUOMO
The house is located on the first floor of a building of the ‘200, in Via del Corso 3, one of the main pedestrian streets of the historic center of Florence and Decumano of the ancient Roman city.
A WONDERFUL LOCATION TO VISIT FLORENCE:
Being very central, with a few steps you will be immersed in art; you will have all the major monuments and museums around you:
- 100m from the Duomo,
- 200m from Piazza della Signoria and the Uffizi,
- 500m from Santa Croce, Ponte Vecchio and the Accademia Gallery.
The street, alive and busy throughout the day, is one of the hearts of the center and sees a rich presence of shops, restaurants and historic bars: breakfast, snacks, beautiful dinners or go shopping will be an incredible pleasure, all at your fingertips.
If you want to prepare something in the room, in the immediate vicinity you can find two supermarkets.

name: Casa Futuristica
description:
The apartment is a new 50 sqm house recently renovated and furnished in a modern and minimalist style.
There is a bathroom with shower, a kitchen space and an airy living room with direct access to a pocket terrace.
The double room is spacious and equipped with a large closet.
neighborhood_overview: The house is a stone's throw from Piazza San Iacopino recently renovated and improved. In the square there are restaurants-pizzerias, bars, a convenience store, and some grocery stores where you can shop. Going up from Piazza S.Iacopino to Via del Ponte Al Asse you can reach the "Ponte al Asse" stop of the Tram. From there you can quickly reach both the Historic Center by traveling in the direction of "Piazza dell 'Unità" and Peretola airport by taking the Tramway in the direction of "Aeroporto".
host_about:
Mi chiamo Lorenzo, ho 30 anni e sono nato a Firenze, per poi trasferirmi a Berlino nel 2019.
Amo il cinema, il fitness e la buona compagnia: da sempre mi piace viaggiare e conoscere persone da tutte le parti del mondo.
Per questo ho deciso di mettere a disposizione la mia casa per altri traveler che vogliano conoscere e vivere una città ricca di bellezza e novità come Firenze. Benvenuti nella 'Hulla del Rinascimento! ;)

Hi everyone, my name is Lorenzo, I am 30 and I was born in Florence.
I love cinema, fitness and the company of good people from all over the world: I love traveling and get to know people from different countries.
This why I am happy to rent my apartment to other travelers willing to know and explore a city full of beauty and life like Florence!
Welcome to Italia! :)

description:

BSL Boutique Suite has nothing to envy to the suites of the most luxurious hotels.
The penthouse is located a few steps from the Duomo of Florence—an ideal location to sightsee the city's monuments.
neighborhood_overview: BSL Boutique Suite is located a few steps from the Duomo of Florence—an ideal location to sightsee the city's monuments. Just a short walk reaches the Cappelle Medicee or the Galleria dell'Accademia, where Michelangelo's David can be admired.
host_about:
Born and raised in Florence, I created this one-of-a-kind apartment with great attention to every detail, offering guests a unique and relaxing stay. I did my best to allow those who want to visit Florence to live a wonderful experience, and that they may love my city the same way i do. 
We are at your complete disposal to answer any questions before and during your stay. We have many tips for the city and its surroundings. To make your experience even better, we are available to assist you in organizing: Airport Transfer, Lunch/Dinner with Private Chef, Florence Private Tours, Tuscany Private Tours, Restaurant Booking.

name: D - Appartamenti CORSO 3 - Vivere Firenze
description: The delightful two-room apartment, completely renovated at the beginning of January 2023, is located in Via del Corso 3 on the first floor of a building of the '200: ideal for guests who want to visit Florence on foot. It consists of a large room with a double bed and a complete kitchen with table and chairs. At guests' disposal there are air conditioning, TV, wifi, all the necessary linen and a hairdryer. Enjoy living downtown!
neighborhood_overview:
ONE STEP AWAY FROM THE DUOMO
Our house is located on the first floor of a building of the ‘200 in Via del Corso, one of the main pedestrian streets of the historic center of Florence and Decumano of the ancient Roman city.
A WONDERFUL LOCATION TO VISIT FLORENCE:
Being very central, with a few steps you will be immersed in art; you have all the major monuments and museums around you:
- 100m from the Duomo,
- 200m from Piazza della Signoria and the Uffizi,
- 500m from Santa Croce, Ponte Vecchio and the Accademia Gallery.
The street, alive and busy throughout the day, is one of the hearts of the center and sees a rich presence of shops, restaurants and historic bars: breakfast, snacks, beautiful dinners or go shopping will be an incredible pleasure, all at your fingertips. If you want to prepare something in the room, in the immediate vicinity you can find two supermarkets.

name: A blend of tradition and modernity.
description:
The apartment is located on the ground floor of an historic building set on a charming street nestled in the Santa Croce neighborhood, just a few minutes away from all of Florence's beauties.

The apartment has been recently renewed, with great attention to detail and in maintaining the rustic, typical features of Florentine traditional homes: original terracotta flooring, beautiful vaulted ceilings with stone capitals and antique furniture items.
neighborhood_overview: Choosing this apartment you'll have the chance to stay in the very heart of the ancient Florence, within walking distance from all the main museums and monuments: the Duomo, Santa Croce, Palazzo Vecchio, Ponte Vecchio, the Uffizi Gallery are all just a short walk away. The neighborhoods of Santa Croce and Sant'Ambrogio are among the most typical and lively areas of Florence, with their restaurants, clubs, cafès, live music bars, daily markets and shops.
host_about:
Hi, I’m Lorenzo!
Thank you for reading my profile! 
If you're passionate about art, music, or food and wine, I will be glad to advise you of the routes to places of interest and good where to taste our Florentine cuisine. 
To welcome you there will be my daughter Giulia and her boyfriend Matteo (the guys in the photo)
If you have any questions feel free to contact me. 

You are welcome!

name: The corner of Boboli
description:
A beautiful apartament close to Porta Romana square for 4 persone with 1 bedroom with a king size bed, 1 kitchen, 1 living room with a sofa bed, 1 large bathroom, 1 small terrace and 1 private covered and free parking in the same building of the apartament.
Easy to get from the main station by bus (14 min) and by car from the close highway.
It's close a Boboli Garden entry, just a few minutes to Palazzo Vecchio and Ponte Vecchio.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartament is located in Porta Romana square close the historic center of Florence,100 meters out of the city walls, near the most famous and biggest garden of Florence, Boboli.
A perfect location to spend nice time in Florence and to see all beautiful monuments of the city.
Porta Romana is the most ancient and biggest entrance of the Florence walls, a little walk through old shops and resturants will get you to San Frediano, Santo Spirito, Palazzo Pitti and the Old Bridge (Ponte Vecchio ).
The apartament is also close to Poggio Imperiale, a green hill where you can do Jogging until Piazzale Michelangelo the most beautiful view point in Florence, you can get it also buy bus number 12, that start from Porta Romana square.

name: The Green Terrace II
description: One double bedroom, large entrance, bathroom, kitchen, terraces
neighborhood_overview: San Frediano is the most popular area of the city center, full of life in the day time such as in the night time, less turisty but close to all the main attractions of the city. Nearby the apartment you will find within 100 meters: bars, bakery, butchery, greengrocer, flower shop, wine shop, farmacy, italian restaurants, pizzeria, specialty coffee bar, homemade beer house and many craftman shops. This is a peace of street where you will be surrounded by locals.
host_about:
Backpacking is the first thing I love. As a traveller I like to meet people like me and share experiences with them. Born and raised in Florence but I lived in the States, Australia and Spain. 
I worked as a sailor on sailing boats in the mediterrenean sea and across the ocean. Now I am a professional nature and rafting guide.
I love nature and that's why whenever I can I go hiking, climbing or sailing. I can play guitar and ukulele and I always try to bring an instrument with me  when I travel, cause music brings people together. 
Stay positive

name: Marignolle relais & charme Firenze - Camera Doppia
description:
Situated just three kilometres far from the historical centre of Florence, this botique hotel overlooks the beautiful hillside countryside around the town.
The nine spacious rooms are immaculately styled reflecting the owners' impeccable taste and attention to detail:
parquet floors, matching fabrics for beds and drapes, and spacious sparkling-white bathrooms. Amenities include satellite TV, mini-bar, safe, air conditioning, wi-fi internet connection, and a selection from the wine cellar.
neighborhood_overview: The hotel is ideally positioned for exploring the historical city centre of Florence as well as enjoying some of the most important medieval tuscan towns as San Gimignano and Siena.
host_about: Sono nato e vissuto a Firenze...è la mia città. Sono laureato in Scienze politiche economiche all'Università Cesare Alfieri. Nell'anno 2001 ho deciso di condividere con ospiti provenienti da tutto il mondo la proprietà di famiglia creando un Relais di Charme. Da quel momento mi dedico tutti giorni a questo lavoro che è diventato una grande passione.

name: Step to Duomo and All the Sights from Refurbished Apartment
description:
Chalk up plans for excursions to the nearby sights on the handy blackboard of an apartment that's been elegantly restored in a bright, contemporary fashion. Fun and eye-catching pieces abound, from a giant wall clock to a suspended basket seat. Enjoy a stunning Duomo view from the windows.

The apartment has just been renovated and is located in one of the most beautiful and prestigious street in the center of Florence, on the 2nd floor of a historic building (therefore without a lift).

The accommodation consists of: living room with dining area, equipped kitchen, 2 bedrooms with double beds and 1 bathroom with shower.

air conditioning (in all rooms), heating, tv, free wifi, sheets, towels, soap, equipped kitchen, bathroom with shower, hairdryer, coffee maker, toaster, iron and ironing board.

name: Pergola 35 - Mattone - In heart of Florence
description:
Ancient and modern blend with one another at Pergola 35, resulting in balance and sophisticated harmony. The entire building has been renovated with respect for every historical characteristic of the "true Florentine home". The original stone stairs, the historic wooden ceilings, and the ancient brick walls have all been meticulously restored and preserved.
The building is also extraordinarily equipped with every modern comfort: new elevator and technical installations with a home automation system. The ancient furnishings are cleverly integrated with objects of design and works of art.

Guests can also enjoy complimentary use of the laundry area, equipped with an automatic washing machine and dryer.

Located in the historical district of Santa Croce, the apartment is just steps away from popular restaurants, wine bars, and all manner of shops. Check out the famous Sant'Ambrogio Market nearby to catch a glimpse of how the locals live.

description:
✔ AirCo
✔ Safe Area
✔ Boboli Gardens 15 minutes walking distance
✔ Chianti 10-15 minutes by car
✔ Free Parking along the street or big parking lot 5 minutes walking distance
✔ Spacious apartment: 68m² (732 ft² )

✔ Mattress topper Sofa Bed

neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in an ideal area for those looking for a compromise between proximity to the historic center and tranquility. The famous Chianti is just a few minutes away by car. Free parking along the road or possibly a 5-minute walk from the apartment you will find a large free car parking for which I will indicate the exact location on the map.
The bus stop is a 2-minute walk from the apartment and lines 11 36 37 lead to the historic center of Florence in 5 minutes. On foot you can reach the walls of the historic center in 15 minutes. Furthermore, the very famous panorama of Piazzale Michelangelo is only 5 minutes away by car.
As for the nearby services, you will find a large supermarket 3 minutes by bus, also equipped with a large underground parking, or a 1 minute walk to the Due Strade area with tasty food and pastry shops for every palate. McDonald's is also very close.
The area in which the apartment is located is also notoriously quiet and peaceful.

description:
Situated just three kilometres far from the historical centre of Florence, this little gem of a hotel overlooks the beautiful hillside countryside around the town.
The ten spacious rooms are immaculately styled reflecting the owners' impeccable taste
neighborhood_overview:
Our Relais takes the name of the hill where it is placed in Florence.
The Marignolle hill is located only 3,5 kilometers from Porta Romana, south acces of the historic center of Florence reachable in just 8 minutes by car/taxi.
Marignolle today is one of the most prestigious residential areas of Florence, rich of Renaissance villas surrounded by cypress and olive trees.
Three minutes from here you will find the Medici Villa of Marignolle and the square with the medieval church.
host_about: Sono nato e vissuto a Firenze...è la mia città. Sono laureato in Scienze politiche economiche all'Università Cesare Alfieri. Nell'anno 2001 ho deciso di condividere con ospiti provenienti da tutto il mondo la proprietà di famiglia creando un Relais di Charme. Da quel momento mi dedico tutti giorni a questo lavoro che è diventato una grande passione.

name: Lovable Top Floor Studio Ponte Vecchio + Lift
description:
Quite and luminous studio to sleep 2, located on the left side of the river arno (Oltrarno), only at 30 yards/meters from ponte vecchio. The studio is on the fifth and last floor with lift.
it is provided of air conditioning/heating, Wi-Fi connection and tv for all your conforts. it is composed by the living, with the window overlooking the main street, has a real double sized bed, a fully equipped kitchenette and a table. there is a parquet floor all over and a bathroom with a large shower.
neighborhood_overview: In the Oltrarno area  you'll find a calmer, more authentic and professional area, full of artisan studios flaunting centuries-old traditions and crafts, not to mention the number of antiques stores, friendly bars and small, family-run restaurants.
host_about:
Hello. Paola and I are pleased to introduce the Ponte Vecchio studios.
this is part of the most fashionable and well located district of central Florence full of restaurants and bars.  I moved to San Niccolò 15 years ago as I left London where I spent 10 wonderful years of my life running my own business as a watch dealer.
now days I am involved in other things such as property maintenance, art, gardening. I also have an interest in italian 60's & 70's lamps and their design, music, Mathematics and the cultural opportunities presented by my city.
I have also a passion about the warp and weft of my town and relish the chance to share this enthusiasm with my guests.
we love travelling and  understand the value of indipendence and reliability when hosting.we are fond of books so the flat is well-filled with them. 
Our flat is always ready for visitors. We like to keep it clean such as you would expect in a good hotel space.
we like positive thinking, old fashioned manners and could not live without a good daily coffee!

name: Mamo Florence - Atelier del Sarto Apartment
description: Located in an extraordinary historical setting, at the foot of Piazzale Michelangelo, in the picturesque district of San Niccolò, this apartment is the ideal choice for those who want to spend a stay in Florence away from the rampant tourism of the historic center. Its location is optimal, well connected and quiet, allowing guests to breathe an atmosphere of the past and enjoy beautiful views.
neighborhood_overview:
The property is located along the ancient route of travelers, one of the most evocative corners of Florence, a rather steep road that goes from the Porta San Miniato, near the Arno, to Viale Galileo, in front of the Basilica of San Miniato al Monte. This trail offers spectacular views of the Tuscan countryside. The road, entirely lined with ancient walls, was one of the most popular routes to enter the city until the nineteenth century. The lower section, covered with grass, offers the most spectacular view of the Florentine hills and the Tuscan capital.

From the district of San Niccolò everything is close: the panoramic Piazzale Michelangelo, the Romanesque Basilica of San Miniato, the wonderful Rose Garden, the Ponte Vecchio and the Uffizi. The Church of Santa Croce, with its architectural wonders and the works of Giotto and Cimabue, and Palazzo Pitti with the Boboli Gardens, are within easy reach.

The area is also full of bars and restaurants, many of which

neighborhood_overview: Located to the south of the River Arno (hence the name meaning ‘other side of the Arno’), the Oltrarno neighborhood is hip, trendy and bohemian area, with boutique shops, amazing restaurants and artisanal workshops creating and selling handmade items. For a slice of culture, head to the amazing Bardini Museum, home to a brilliant collection of classic sculptures. There is also the Gallery of Modern Art that sits in the Pitti Palace (former home of the powerful Medici family) and showcases a large collection of paintings and sculptures from the 19th and 20th Century. Between the Via Maggio and Piazza Pitti, you’ll find small streets full of little artisan workshops, where you’ll see everything from jewelry to books and shoes to musical instruments being made by hand. Buying souvenirs from these shops will cost you less and allow you to support the craftsmen and women of the city. description:

It has one double bedroom, a fully equipped kitchen, a sofa bed and a bathroom with a shower.
There is also a washer and a dryier for exclusive use, smart TV, WIFI, safe locker in each room, large fridge and freezer, many appliances, large wardrobe, security door, smoke detector.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in a quiet street in the Porta al Prato district. Nearby are the most convenient public transport stops to easily reach every part of the city.
The Cascine Park, the Lungarni, the Opera Theater are just a few steps away.
In the immediately adjacent street there is a well-stocked supermarket, restaurants of all kinds (Tuscan, Japanese, Mexican, fish, pizzerias), a pastry shop as well as many other services (for example bank and pharmacy).

✔Wifi (DL 28Mbps , UP 3Mbps)

neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in an ideal area for those looking for a compromise between proximity to the historic center and tranquility. The famous Chianti is just a few minutes away by car. Free parking along the road or possibly a 5-minute walk from the apartment you will find a large free car parking for which I will indicate the exact location on the map.
The bus stop is a 2-minute walk from the apartment and lines 11 36 37 lead to the historic center of Florence in 5 minutes. On foot you can reach the walls of the historic center in 15 minutes. Furthermore, the very famous panorama of Piazzale Michelangelo is only 5 minutes away by car.
As for the nearby services, you will find a large supermarket 3 minutes by bus, also equipped with a large underground parking, or a 1 minute walk to the Due Strade area with tasty food and pastry shops for every palate. McDonald's is also very close.
The area in which the apartment is located is also notoriously quiet and peaceful.

name: Duomo Secret Rooftop
description:
The apartment is a penthouse of a building located in the historic center of Florence, a stone's throw from Piazza Duomo and Piazza della Signoria. It's old-fashioned and refined.
Maximum capacity for 7 people. You will be mesmerized by the view on the terrace
neighborhood_overview:
Duomo Secret Rooftop is in the heart of Florence.
A stone's throw from Piazza della Repubblica, one of the major squares of Florence and the center of the city since Roman times. In the center of the Piazza is the Colonna dell 'Abbondanza, the belly button of the city, symbol of the meeting point of the main streets of the ancient Roman city, the Cardo and the Decumanus.

The area occupied by the Old Market, except for the Colonna dell 'Abbondanza, was entirely razed to the ground and, in its place, the elegant Piazza della Repubblica was built surrounded by large palaces, prestigious shops and overlooked by the triumphal arch on whose tombstone it is inscribed: "The ancient center of the city from centuries-old squalor to new life returned". The square still houses some of the most sought-after shops and clubs in Florence, such as the "Giubbe Rosse", a meeting place, always, of writers and intellectuals.

neighborhood_overview:
A STONE'S THROW FROM THE DUOMO
The house is located on the first floor of a building of the ‘200, in Via del Corso 3, one of the main pedestrian streets of the historic center of Florence and Decumano of the ancient Roman city.
A WONDERFUL LOCATION TO VISIT FLORENCE:
Being very central, with a few steps you will be immersed in art; you will have all the major monuments and museums around you:
- 100m from the Duomo,
- 200m from Piazza della Signoria and the Uffizi,
- 500m from Santa Croce, Ponte Vecchio and the Accademia Gallery.
The street, alive and busy throughout the day, is one of the hearts of the center and sees a rich presence of shops, restaurants and historic bars: breakfast, snacks, beautiful dinners or go shopping will be an incredible pleasure, all at your fingertips.
If you want to prepare something in the room, in the immediate vicinity you can find two supermarkets.

name: Pitti Portrait
description:
Located in the most beautiful square of Florence, in front of the Medici’s Palace (Palazzo Pitti), this newly renovated and quiet apartment will surprise you for the high attention to detail and the comfort. From the 2 big door windows you will enjoy one of the most beautiful and exclusive views of Florence.  
 
The apartment is perfect for short and long stays, it is fully equipped and it will make you feel right at home.
neighborhood_overview:
Pitti Portrait is located In front of Palazzo Pitti, home of Renaissance paintings by artists such as Raphael, Titian and Perugino, it’s one of the city’s must-see museums.

Behind Palazzo Pitti, the Boboli Gardens are an expansive park featuring fountains, sculptures and manicured lawns.

Oltrarno area, which literally means "on the other side of the Arno’’.
You'll find a calmer, more authentic and professional area leave the crowds behind at the Duomo and wander over to Oltrarno, a vibrant neighbourhood where Florentines have been hiding out for years. Filled with artisanal boutiques, art galleries and trendy eateries – not to mention, ample parks and gardens – it will please culture hunters and nature enthusiasts alike.

This expansive part of the city runs from Santo Spirito to San Frediano and is best explored on foot: don’t be afraid to get lost in the picturesque alleyways and enjoy the neighbourhood’s unique mix of historic venues and Renais
host_about:
Born and raised in Florence, I created this one-of-a-kind apartment with great attention to every detail, offering guests a unique and relaxing stay. I did my best to allow those who want to visit Florence to live a wonderful experience, and that they may love my city the same way i do. 
We are at your complete disposal to answer any questions before and during your stay. We have many tips for the city and its surroundings. To make your experience even better, we are available to assist you in organizing: Airport Transfer, Lunch/Dinner with Private Chef, Florence Private Tours, Tuscany Private Tours, Restaurant Booking.

name: Appartamento con due camere da letto vicino centro
description:
Spacious and comfortable apartment, it has two bedrooms and can accommodate up to 4 people, perfect for a family or even a group of friends.
We are only 7 minutes from Campo di Marte station
And a quarter hour from the center, near the apartment there are 3 supermarkets and it is 300 meters from the Artemio Franchi stadium, it is also very close to the Nelson Mandela Forum in Florence, so it is convenient for concerts,
Immediately at the foot of Fiesole
neighborhood_overview:
Built in the early 1800s by Luigi de Cambray Digny, Campo di Marte is one of Florence's most dynamic neighbourhoods, a stone's throw from the historic centre and well served by public transport.

Villini in Art Nouveau style, early 1900s condominiums and buildings from the 70s are the typical architecture of the area that from the Lungarno del Tempio winds between Viale Gramsci and Viale Mazzini. We think of the proximity – really surprising – to the main attractions of the city.

Campo di Marte is known for the Church of the Seven Founding Saints and the Nelson Mandela Forum; but also for its green areas and playgrounds – the Light Garden and the Playground are among them – ideal places for children and for relaxing walks.

Do you love football and sports? Even better: if you stay in my house you will be a stone's throw from the Artemio Franchi Stadium.

name: Pitti Luxury Flat
description: The perfect setting to make your stay in magical Florence truly unique is ready to welcome you, a luxury location, for quality lovers. With a breathtaking view of one of the most important squares in the historic center, you can relax in the armchair overlooking Palazzo Pitti! After leaving the house, it's only a two-minute walk and you'll find yourself at Ponte Vecchio. What would you like more of?
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to the heart of Florence, the artistic and cultural birthplace of Italy and a nest of treasures of priceless value. In fact, you are immersed in one of the coolest, most authentic and representative neighborhoods in the city: the Oltrarno neighborhood, lively and lived in by historic artisan boutiques, art galleries, restaurants and fine dining venues. The location is among the best for discovering all the city's monuments, as well as getting to know the real local life. Looking out the windows of the house, you can be enchanted by the gentle flow of the Arno and, following it with your eyes, wandering around the city admiring all its sights, from the Cathedral's dome, Ponte Vecchio and to Palazzo Vecchio and beyond! Being in the most central part of the city, just take a step outside your front door to immerse yourself in the history and magic of Florence and get to know its countless and priceless treasures.

neighborhood_overview: San Frediano the coolest quarter of Florence
host_about:
Ciao sono Matilde, 
mamma di Sofia e moglie di Gabriele, 
ho sempre viaggiato tanto per lavoro e per piacere e mi piace conoscere persone di tutte le nazionalità. 

Quando prenoto alberghi o case apprezzo il servizio, la pulizia, l’eleganza , il confort e la disponibilità degli host. Per questo ho deciso insieme a mio marito Gabriele di creare per voi l’appartamento che vorrei trovare in ogni città.

Ho scelto di vivere a Firenze perché la trovo la città più bella . Soprattuto i quartieri San Frediano e Santo Spirito ritraggono una Firenze antica , caratteristica, ma piena di vita. 

Lonely Planet ha definito San Frediano il quartiere più Cool del mondo addirittura "meglio di Dubai e New York"

E se lo dice Lonely Planet è una garanzia. 

Non vediamo l’ora di ospitarvi !

name: Lupo Luxury Home
description: This elegant apartment located in the fantastic neighborhood of San Niccolò and a stone's throw from the Arno River is the ideal place to enjoy Florence with the utmost comfort.
neighborhood_overview:
San Niccolò is the oldest neighborhood in Florence and among the historic areas most loved by Florentines for its quiet atmosphere. The neighborhood of San Niccolò was once one of the main entrances to the city, and today it is one of the meeting points for young people thanks to its pubs and restaurants. You knew that the famous Bar Necchi in the film "My Friends" is located on the parallel street of Via di San Niccolò, 1 minute from the Palace!

San Niccolò is the area of Florence that has completely preserved its medieval atmosphere, remembering a small Tuscan village with cobbled streets still intact and massive walls of the 13th century.
One of the main attractions of the neighborhood is undoubtedly the Torre di San Niccolò, or rather the Gate.

name: Barbadori Tower Apartment
description:
Located on the top floor of the Torre Barbadori, a historic Florentine palace designed by the prestigious architect Filippo Lippi, this penthouse is the ideal place for a stay in Florence.
Coming down from the apartment we are in Borgo San Jacopo, a historic street, a stone's throw from the old bridge and the city's main attractions.
neighborhood_overview:
Borgo San Jacopo is one of the streets that tells the story of Florence more.
It's enclosed by two of the most important bridges. On one side we have Ponte Santa Trinita with the statues of the 4 seasons and on the other, Ponte Vecchio, the historic bridge with historical jewelry.
On this street you can admire one of the oldest towers in Florence, coming from Ponte Vecchio you can immediately meet the famous Torre de Rossi. Here we also find the niche with the Giambologna Bacchus fountain, the original, bronze statue is now located at the Bargello museum.

A little further on and exactly at number 54 we find the beautiful Barbadori Tower that with its delicious square overlooking the Arno allows us an enchanting view of Ponte Vecchio.

Right in front of the Barbadori Tower is the fun and picturesque Belfredelli Tower, one of the best preserved towers in Florence.

name: Palazzo Cecchi Luxury Apartment
description:
Located on the top floor of Palazzo Cecchi, a historic Florentine palace belonging for generations to the Cecchi family.
This penthouse is the ideal place if you want to stay in Florence.
neighborhood_overview:
The Santa Croce neighborhood is located in the southeast part of Florence's historic center. The main monument in this area is the Church of Santa Croce located in the square of the same name. Inside we find tombs of illustrious artists such as Machiavelli, Alfieri and Michelangelo.
The square is also renowned for historic Florentine football, a historic event that hosts every year and that is still very much followed by its citizens and the rest of the world. These are medieval football matches where the 4 historic neighborhoods of the city are challenged by the Reds of Santa Maria Novella, the Greens of San Giovanni, the blues of Santa Croce and the whites of Santo Spirito.

description: A modern apartment located in the heart of the city, a stone's throw from the prestigious Amerigo Vespucci promenade, the city's main historic streets and cultural attractions.
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the heart of downtown Florence. Surrounded by the main streets of fashion and antiques, such as Via de' Tornabuoni and Via del Moro.
Despite the optimal location you will find yourself in a quite quiet area, full of restaurants and clubs, but at the same time the history of the city.
In the neighborhood you can admire the so-called wine holes, one of them on Via delle Belle Donne. At the same time you are just a few steps from the majestic Cathedral of Florence and the nearby Baptistery and Campanile di Giotto, the Church of Santa Maria Novella and its fascinating cloister, from Piazza della Repubblica that represents the intersection of the ancient Roman streets Cardo and Decumanus and the characteristic Palazzo della Signoria flanked by one of the most important museums in the world, the Uffizi Gallery and the historic Ponte Vecchio.

description: A beautiful apartment located in the coolest neighborhood of the city, the ideal place to enjoy Florence in total tranquility a stone's throw from the city's major monuments.
neighborhood_overview:
Narrow streets and tiny sidewalks, small craft shops and local bars, mixed with new pubs and restaurants, create a village atmosphere where you can almost savor the Florence of the past flavored by the freshness of the young people passing by. This is the recipe that makes San Frediano the coolest neighborhood in the world.
San Frediano has brought a new spirit to the Oltrarno area, with all new, modern and contemporary local, but without losing its essence. On the southern side of Florence's Arno, San Frediano offers the most genuine Florentine experience.

name: Charme In Santa Maria Novella
description:
Enjoy a break in this delightful apartment in the center of Florence.
Its location is one of its strengths, since it is a few minutes walk from Santa Maria Novella station and the historic center, where we can admire the Duomo, Palazzo Vecchio, the Church of Santa Maria Novella and many other monuments.
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the heart of downtown Florence. Surrounded by the main streets of fashion and antiques, such as Via de' Tornabuoni and Via del Moro.
Despite the optimal location you will find yourself in a quite quiet area, full of restaurants and clubs, but at the same time the history of the city.
In the neighborhood you can admire the so-called wine holes, one of them on Via delle Belle Donne. At the same time you are just a few steps from the majestic Cathedral of Florence and the nearby Baptistery and Campanile di Giotto, the Church of Santa Maria Novella and its fascinating cloister, from Piazza della Repubblica that represents the intersection of the ancient Roman streets Cardo and Decumanus and the characteristic Palazzo della Signoria flanked by one of the most important museums in the world, the Uffizi Gallery and the historic Ponte Vecchio.

name: Duomo Deluxe Apartment
description: A beautiful apartment located in the heart of the city, the ideal place to enjoy Florence in full Florence in total tranquility a stone's throw from the city's major monuments.
neighborhood_overview:
Duomo Deluxe Apartment is in the heart of Florence.
A stone's throw from Piazza della Repubblica, one of the major squares of Florence and the center of the city since Roman times. In the center of the Piazza is the Colonna dell 'Abbondanza, the belly button of the city, symbol of the meeting point of the main streets of the ancient Roman city, the Cardo and the Decumanus.

The area occupied by the Old Market, except for the Colonna dell 'Abbondanza, was entirely razed to the ground and, in its place, the elegant Piazza della Repubblica was built surrounded by large palaces, prestigious shops and overlooked by the triumphal arch on whose tombstone it is inscribed: "The ancient center of the city from centuries-old squalor to new life returned". The square still houses some of the most sought-after shops and clubs in Florence, such as the "Giubbe Rosse", a meeting place, always, of writers and intellectuals.

name: Ponte Vecchio Prestige Apartment
description:
Located inside Palazzo Stiozzi-Ridolfi, made by the famous architect and sculptor Fiorentino Baccio d 'Agnolo, this spacious apartment is the ideal place for a stay in Florence.
The apartment is in the historic district of San Niccolò from which you can walk to the city's main attractions.
neighborhood_overview:
San Niccolò is the oldest neighborhood in Florence and among the historic areas most loved by Florentines for its quiet atmosphere. The neighborhood of San Niccolò was once one of the main entrances to the city, and today it is one of the meeting points for young people thanks to its pubs and restaurants. You knew that the famous Bar Necchi in the film "My Friends" is located on the parallel street of Via di San Niccolò, 1 minute from the Palace!

San Niccolò is the area of Florence that has completely preserved its medieval atmosphere, remembering a small Tuscan village with cobbled streets still intact and massive walls of the 13th century.
One of the main attractions of the neighborhood is undoubtedly the Torre di San Niccolò, or rather the Gate.

name: "Milune" Duomo
description:
Prestigious apartment for 4 people, strategic location in the historic center of Florence 200 m from the Duomo.
It is enveloping and comfortable, tastefully furnished, can accommodate up to 4 people.
It's on the first floor with an elevator.
It has just been renovated and consists of: two double bedrooms with a walk-in closet and ensuite bathroom with a shower, in one you can have an option for single beds, a large living room with a 3rd bathroom, an equipped kitchen and an outdoor courtyard furnished for eating.
neighborhood_overview:
Via dei Servi is one of the most characteristic streets of the historical center, it connects the majestic Piazza del Duomo to that of the Santissima Annunziata. Suggestive is the view from both sides, with the equestrian statue of Ferdinando I de' Medici and the Brunelleschi Dome at the ends.
Via dei Servi offers the digital art of Leonardo Da Vinci's interactive museum, a comfortable supermarket, a paid garage nearby, characteristic art and craft shops, typical restaurants and wine bars.

name: Pitti Deluxe Apartment
description:
Stylish apartment located in the heart of Florentine history, between Ponte Vecchio and Palazzo Pitti. It is steps away from the Arno River.
Thanks to the central location of this accommodation, it is the ideal place if you want to fully enjoy Florence and all its wonders with maximum comfort.
neighborhood_overview:
Borgo San Jacopo is one of the streets that tells the story of Florence more.
It's enclosed by two of the most important bridges. On one side we have Ponte Santa Trinita with the statues of the 4 seasons and on the other, Ponte Vecchio, the historic bridge with historical jewelry.
On this street you can admire one of the oldest towers in Florence, coming from Ponte Vecchio you can immediately meet the famous Torre de Rossi. Here we also find the niche with the Giambologna Bacchus fountain, the original, bronze statue is now located at the Bargello museum.

A little further on and exactly at number 54 we find the beautiful Barbadori Tower that with its delicious square overlooking the Arno allows us an enchanting view of Ponte Vecchio.

Right in front of the Barbadori Tower is the fun and picturesque Belfredelli Tower, one of the best preserved towers in Florence.

name: Loft Botticelli_cozy loft in the heart of Florence
description:
In the heart of the Santa Croce district in Florence, Loft Botticelli is a ground-floor loft in a typical Florentine building, recently renovated and equipped with all the comforts for your stay. It's ideal for hosting up to 4 guests, thanks to a comfortable double bed and a sofa bed.
Loft Botticelli is located 5-minute walk from the Basilica of Santa Croce, 10 minutes from the Cathedral of Santa Maria del Fiore and Piazza della Signoria, and 20 minutes from the Santa Maria Novella Station!
neighborhood_overview:
The Santa Croce district is one of the most historic and lively neighborhoods in Florence, known for its invaluable cultural and artistic heritage.
Santa Croce is a blend of history and contemporary life. During the day, it's a magnet for tourists, but at night, it transforms into a hotspot for the youth due to its numerous bars, restaurants, and clubs. The district's narrow, winding streets are a maze of artisan shops, antique stores, and traditional cafes.
In addition to its artistic and architectural wealth, Santa Croce is also a significant center for cultural activities. It hosts concerts, exhibitions, performances, and other cultural events that attract both locals and visitors.
The Santa Croce neighborhood embodies the essence of Florence, combining history, art, culture, and contemporary life in a vibrant and welcoming space.

Secluded - Zona Savonarola
Via Pier Capponi is located near Piazza Savonarola, dedicated to the Ferrara friar and the comrades who were hanged and hanged with him. In the center of the square, a statue was erected in his honor surrounded by trees.

name: Ponte Vecchio Elegant
description:
Relax in this quiet space located in a historic neighborhood par excellence, a stone's throw from the magical Ponte Vecchio.
Ponte Vecchio Elegant offers a comfortable and refined accommodation for those who want to discover Florence. Equipped with all necessary comforts such as wifi, washing machine.
neighborhood_overview:
Borgo San Jacopo is one of the streets that tells the story of Florence more.
It's enclosed by two of the most important bridges. On one side we have Ponte Santa Trinita with the statues of the 4 seasons and on the other, Ponte Vecchio, the historic bridge with historical jewelry.
On this street you can admire one of the oldest towers in Florence, coming from Ponte Vecchio you can immediately meet the famous Torre de Rossi. Here we also find the niche with the Giambologna Bacchus fountain, the original, bronze statue is now located at the Bargello museum.

A little further on and exactly at number 54 we find the beautiful Barbadori Tower that with its delicious square overlooking the Arno allows us an enchanting view of Ponte Vecchio.

Right in front of the Barbadori Tower is the fun and picturesque Belfredelli Tower, one of the best preserved towers in Florence.
The tower is among the highest still standing in the city, it is well recognized becau

name: Santa Croce Comfort Apartment
description:
Relax in this quiet, centrally located apartment, just steps from the Sant'Ambrogio Market and the church of Santa Croce.
Ideal place to retreat from the chaos of the city and fully enjoy the wonders of Florence.
neighborhood_overview:
The Santa Croce neighborhood is located in the southeast part of Florence's historic center. The main monument in this area is the Church of Santa Croce located in the square of the same name. Inside we find tombs of illustrious artists such as Machiavelli, Alfieri and Michelangelo.
The square is also renowned for historic Florentine football, a historic event that hosts every year and that is still very much followed by its citizens and the rest of the world. These are medieval football matches where the 4 historic neighborhoods of the city are challenged by the Reds of Santa Maria Novella, the Greens of San Giovanni, the blues of Santa Croce and the whites of Santo Spirito.

name: Santo Spirito Deluxe Apartment
description: Modern apartment located in the fantastic neighborhood of San Spirito a stone's throw from the Arno River. It is the ideal place to enjoy Florence with maximum comfort.
neighborhood_overview:
The vibrant neighborhood of Santo Spirito is a landmark for those who want to experience a pleasant and relaxing atmosphere.
Its central square, overlooking the basilica of the same name, is much loved by the inhabitants and visitors who are used to linger on the stone steps of the churchyard to exchange a chat or sip a drink in one of its premises, especially on hot summer nights.
The neighborhood has become over time a meeting point for young people, for families with children and for groups of friends who gather here to spend time together.

name: Tornabuoni Dream
description:
Elegant and refined apartment located on the fashion street.
The place is ideal if you want to fully enjoy Florence and all its wonders with maximum comfort.
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the heart of downtown Florence. Surrounded by the main streets of fashion and antiques, such as Via de' Tornabuoni and Via del Moro.
Despite the optimal location you will find yourself in a quite quiet area, full of restaurants and clubs, but at the same time the history of the city.
In the neighborhood you can admire the so-called wine holes, one of them on Via delle Belle Donne. At the same time you are just a few steps from the majestic Cathedral of Florence and the nearby Baptistery and Campanile di Giotto, the Church of Santa Maria Novella and its fascinating cloister, from Piazza della Repubblica that represents the intersection of the ancient Roman streets Cardo and Decumanus and the characteristic Palazzo della Signoria flanked by one of the most important museums in the world, the Uffizi Gallery and the historic Ponte Vecchio.

description: A comfortable apartment located in the coolest neighborhood of the city, the ideal place to fully enjoy Florence in total tranquility a stone's throw from the major monuments of the city.
neighborhood_overview:
Narrow streets and tiny sidewalks, small craft shops and local bars, mixed with new pubs and restaurants, create a village atmosphere where you can almost savor the Florence of the past flavored by the freshness of the young people passing by. This is the recipe that makes San Frediano the coolest neighborhood in the world.
San Frediano has brought a new spirit to the Oltrarno area, with all new, modern and contemporary local, but without losing its essence. On the southern side of Florence's Arno, San Frediano offers the most genuine Florentine experience.

In compenso, se volete la nostra compagnia, ci piace molto conoscere e passare il tempo con persone da tutto il mondo, anche se non siamo spesso a casa! Possiamo accompagnarvi a visitare qualcosa, oppure portarvi a mangiare in qualche posto originale, vedere uno spettacolo, o anche passare una serata insieme a chiacchierare e fare giochi da tavolo!

name: Borgo Pinti Living
description:
Thanks to the central location of this property, the entire group will have easy access to all the local attractions.
Its location is one of its strengths, it is located in the heart of the historic center, where we can admire the Duomo, Palazzo Vecchio, the Church of Santa Croce, the National Library, the Uffizi and many other monuments to discover.
neighborhood_overview:
The Santa Croce neighborhood is located in the southeast part of Florence's historic center. The main monument in this area is the Church of Santa Croce located in the square of the same name. Inside we find tombs of illustrious artists such as Machiavelli, Alfieri and Michelangelo.
The square is also renowned for historic Florentine football, a historic event that hosts every year and that is still very much followed by its citizens and the rest of the world. These are medieval football matches where the 4 historic neighborhoods of the city are challenged by the Reds of Santa Maria Novella, the Greens of San Giovanni, the blues of Santa Croce and the whites of Santo Spirito.

neighborhood_overview:
We are in the heart of downtown Florence. Surrounded by the main streets of fashion and antiques, such as Via de' Tornabuoni and Via del Moro.
Despite the optimal location you will find yourself in a quite quiet area, full of restaurants and clubs, but at the same time the history of the city.
In the neighborhood you can admire the so-called wine holes, one of them on Via delle Belle Donne. At the same time you are just a few steps from the majestic Cathedral of Florence and the nearby Baptistery and Campanile di Giotto, the Church of Santa Maria Novella and its fascinating cloister, from Piazza della Repubblica that represents the intersection of the ancient Roman streets Cardo and Decumanus and the characteristic Palazzo della Signoria flanked by one of the most important museums in the world, the Uffizi Gallery and the historic Ponte Vecchio.

name: Toscanella Charming Apartment
description:
Elegant and refined apartment located in the Borgo San Jacopo district just steps from the Arno River.
The place is ideal if you want to fully enjoy Florence and all its wonders with maximum comfort.
neighborhood_overview:
The area is one of the most evocative of the city, it still retains that artisan flavor and small neighborhood that will make you love it. You can visit Florence without the help of public transport, just walking. You will find all the major monuments around there. For those who love to go out even in the evening, Piazza Santo Spirito or Piazza Santa Croce with their many places are easily accessible.

Borgo San Jacopo is one of the streets that tells the story of Florence more.
It's enclosed by two of the most important bridges. On one side we have Ponte Santa Trinita with the statues of the 4 seasons and on the other, Ponte Vecchio, the historic bridge with historical jewelry.
On this street you can admire one of the oldest towers in Florence, coming from Ponte Vecchio you can immediately meet the famous Torre de Rossi. Here we also find the niche with the Giambologna Bacchus fountain, the original, bronze statue is now located at the Bargello museum.

name: Boboli Luxury Apartment
description:
Enjoy a stylish vacation in this downtown space.
In the delightful setting of Via Romana you can find this modern apartment.
It is a beautiful property located near one of the most beautiful gardens in Florence, the Boboli Garden.
neighborhood_overview:
Via Romana in Florence is a long street in the Oltrarno district that led to the Porta Romana from Piazza della Calza, so called because it faces south towards the road to Rome. Together with Via Maggio and Via de 'Serragli on the north-south axis the neighborhood of Oltrarno, and stretches from Piazza San Felice, a few steps from Palazzo Pitti, to the walls.
Ancient Via Romana, since it was on the central axis that cuts in two the city was therefore crossed by these travelers and pilgrims, for this reason, along its route there are still numerous buildings that were once hospitals for the care and accommodation of travelers. There are news of nine hospitals overlooking this street, but some have completely lost track.
Over time, the area has changed its appearance, especially after the Grand Ducal was moved to the nearby Pitti Palace, quickly becoming a fashionable area among the richest families.

description:
Stylish apartment located in the heart of Florentine history, between Ponte Vecchio and Palazzo Pitti. It is steps away from the Arno River.

neighborhood_overview:
Via de 'Guicciardini is a street in the historic center of Florence, located in Oltrarno, which represents the extension on the north-south axis of the thistle beyond the Ponte Vecchio. In fact, the street goes from the bridge to Piazza de' Pitti. Along the route they connect: Via de' Barbadori, Piazza Santa Felicita and Via dello Sprone.

The road represents the route of the Via Cassia as a continuation of the maximum thistle beyond the southern gate and then the main river crossing.
Before the thirteenth century, when the city was walled only on the north side, they left the Ponte Vecchio - fortified by high towers - three streets called "villages": village San Jacopo to the west, the village of Piazza towards the south and the village Pitiglioso ("pidocchioso") to the east. With the inclusion of the area in the Arnolfian walls, the three villages became roadways, which in order are today the unchanged village of San Jacopo, Via Guicciardini and Via de' Bardi.

Viuzzo delle Canne is a short walk from Via Gioberti, characterized by its many commercial establishments that envy the streets of the center such as Via Calzaiuoli.
There are numerous bars and restaurants that allow you to accommodate all the cravings that one can have. It goes from pizzerias to seafood restaurants to Tuscan restaurants.

In Florence, everyone knows Via Gioberti and its "hundred shops": a vital neighborhood, full of shops and venues, which seems to maintain an atmosphere typical of an old-world Florence. The pedestrian street between Borgo la Croce and Via Gioberti is a favorite for Florentines, both for shopping and for living and working. It is an area at the gates of the historic center, but also very close to the green of the Lungarni, where many residents go for jogging and walks.

name: [Center] Modern apartment in Piazza Tasso
description:
Do you want to spend an unforgettable stay in the historic center of Florence?

This wonderful and modern apartment, located a few meters from the Arno River and just a few minutes walk from the biggest tourist attractions, will allow you to fully experience the Florentine city.

The apartment with its floral style, is ideal for friends or families looking for a unique location in the historic center to spend a dream holiday in Florence!
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in front of Piazza Tasso, close to museums and major tourist points of interest.

Just 10/20 min on foot, walking along the Arno River, you can reach Ponte Vecchio, Uffizi, Piazza Santo Spirito, Duomo, Piazza San Lorenzo.

description:
The apartment San Marco Loft is in a nice and quiet area of the historical city center of Florence, two steps to piazza San Marco and the boulevards. This area is very well served by public transport and it's close to the museums as the Galleria dell'Accademia, the Museo di San Marco and the Archaeological Museum.
The apartment can comfortably accommodate up to 5 people and is equipped with air conditioning, internet Wi-Fi and independent heating; ideal both for a family and a group of friends.
neighborhood_overview: San Marco Loft is located in a perfect central position into the heart of Florence. All the museum and the monuments of the city are at a ridicolous distance from the house, the most "distant" as Palazzo Pitti are still less than a kilometre away, almost 10 minutes walk!

Located on the ground floor with no stairs to climb, the apartment has a fully equipped kitchen, a living room with a single sofa bed, a bedroom with two single beds, a full bathroom, and a large private courtyard.
The apartment is equipped with basic daily necessities such as WiFi, washing machine, microwave oven, etc.

name: Magenta, With Style in Florence
description:
Magenta is a charming apartment on the 3rd floor (no elevator) of a historic building in the UNESCO-preserved area of Florence’s city center.
It is centrally located, and a short stroll from the Arno river.
Accommodating up to 3 guests it offers a spacious living area, a master bedroom, a smaller bedroom with a desk, a fully equipped kitchen, a cozy bathroom with shower, and plenty of storage space.
Its original frescoed walls, porpora finishings, and natural light exude Italian warmth.
host_about:
I am a music composer passionate about nature, landscapes, adventure and arts.
I was born and bred in Florence and I feel a strong connection with my city, its beauty, history and culture. 
I have tried to instill this passion into the apartment, by decorating it with stylish finishes that would bring my love for Florence to life.

Sono un giovane ragazzo fiorentino,volenteroso di far conoscere la mia città a tutti coloro che sono attratti da essa.
Adoro il cinema, la buona musica, l'arte e la pittura, appassionato anche di orologi e di abbigliamento.
Cerco di ospitare in maniera confidenziale ma allo stesso tempo professionale, spero sempre di mettere a proprio agio il cliente, cercando di fargli apprezzare il mio alloggio.
